item.title: Hacker News Top Stories: Sunday, November 10, 2024 at 7:15 AM UTC
item.description:
1. OpenCoder: Open Cookbook for Top-Tier Code Large Language Models (369 points | 41 comments)
2. IronCalc – Open-Source Spreadsheet Engine (349 points | 102 comments)
3. Shaderblocks: Block-based image editing (43 points | 2 comments)
4. Show HN: Visprex – Open-source, in-browser data visualisation tool for CSV files (107 points | 12 comments)
5. NYC Subway Station Layouts (171 points | 53 comments)
6. Show HN: Jaws – a JavaScript to WASM ahead-of-time compiler (183 points | 71 comments)
7. Zig's (.{}){} Syntax (154 points | 73 comments)
8. FrontierMath: A benchmark for evaluating advanced mathematical reasoning in AI (97 points | 39 comments)
9. Physical Intelligence's first generalist policy AI can finally do your laundry (26 points | 2 comments)
10. Mergiraf: a syntax-aware merge driver for Git (342 points | 74 comments)
11. A skeleton made from the bones of at least eight people thousands of years apart (42 points | 7 comments)
12. GenMC: Model checking for concurrent C programs (5 points | discuss)
13. Early Cascade Injection: From Windows process creation to stealthy injection (96 points | 11 comments)
14. Grim Fandango (178 points | 58 comments)
15. Show HN: HTML-to-Markdown – convert entire websites to Markdown with Golang/CLI (271 points | 43 comments)
16. When machine learning tells the wrong story (114 points | 10 comments)
17. Hard Cases for a Handle Theory (8 points | discuss)
18. HPV vaccination: How the world can eliminate cervical cancer (348 points | 161 comments)
19. Texture-Less Text Rendering (187 points | 46 comments)
20. Ticketmaster’s attempt to game arbitration services fails (271 points | 113 comments)
21. You too can write a book (111 points | 35 comments)
22. Scientist treated her own cancer with viruses she grew in the lab (469 points | 173 comments)
23. Obtainium: Get Android App Updates Directly from the Source (181 points | 76 comments)
24. Since the '60s, Ford has stored cars underground in a Kansas City cave (162 points | 64 comments)
25. Notes on Guyana (133 points | 106 comments)
26. Verbalize – text editor with writing assistance for Brazilian Portuguese (17 points | 1 comment)
27. Somebody moved the UK's oldest satellite in the mid 1970s, but no one knows who (110 points | 55 comments)
28. SVDQuant: 4-Bit Quantization Powers 12B Flux on a 16GB 4090 GPU with 3x Speedup (161 points | 56 comments)
29. Can humans say the largest prime number before we find the next one? (295 points | 131 comments)
30. Trellis (YC W24) is hiring eng to turn documents into database ( | hide)
item.guid: Hacker News Top Stories: Sunday, November 10, 2024 at 7:15 AM UTC
